result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Zagar Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J. Zagar Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J. Zagar Jr. was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at $75.00 per month commencing December 1, 2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Zagar Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J. Zagar in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:42 PM. Ferguson - resolved - dismiss count #1 and amend count #2 to be amended to delete domestic abuse enhancer with free to argue for a fine with costs or costs only. State agrees. Court dismisses count #1. Court amends count #2 to delete the domestic abuse enchancer. Zagar pleads NC to count #2 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation with restitution as indicated on restitution report (already posted) and asks for a fine of $300.00 plus costs. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation with costs only for stated reasons. Zagar makes statement, remorseful. Victim is in the courtroom but does not wish to make a statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: restitution as indicated in the restitution report - take bond posted, costs only of $443.00 - paid at a rate of $75.00/month commencing 12/1/15/CO, submit DNA sample and gives expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Voluntary Wiaver Request to Waive the Court Ordered No Contact Provision - Modified as requested by Judge.

Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:32 PM. Ferguson provides court with authorization to appear. Court accepts auth. Ferguson pleads NG to all counts, set for FPT. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT. Ferguson - bond - victim has written a letter regarding dropping the no-contact provision. Victim is in court, has received the paperwork in the mail to get it lifted, will take care of that. Court continues bond at this point and will follow procedures for getting it lifted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Victim AL wishes no contact removed. Sent to JA.
and Order - Court appointed attorney, repayment at the rate of $100/month, commencing 10/1/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J. Zagar in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:27 AM. Zagar handed complaint in court. Zagar informs Court why he was not in court last time, got dates confused. State - defendnat normally appears for Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Zagar understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 10:47 AM. Burns informs Court that the defendant is not eligible for SPD. Court provides with defendant with court appointed attorney information. Court sets for AIA on 9/30/15 at 9:00 AM. Court gives ramifications of appearing without counsel at next hearing. State - bond - no objections to signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - reinstate signature bond with no contact with victim, no entry into any bars or taverns and no consumption of alcohol. Court continues signature bond with the same conditions that were previously set. Clerk can release the $500.00 bond that was posted to poster.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 09-09-2015 09:30 am
Warrant paid - Clerk of Court Office

Defendant Robert J. Zagar not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:26 AM. State requests forfeiture of any bond if posted and bench warrant, body or $500.00. Court so orders.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (Ashley Lett)
